content.content: Bridging Web3 Domains with AI Agent Discovery
The Challenge of AI Agent Discovery

The rapid proliferation of AI agents and MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers created a critical discovery problem. **How do users find and connect with specialized AI services?** Traditional centralized registries pose risks of censorship, single points of failure, and lack of transparency.\n\nI set out to create a decentralized solution that would leverage Web3 domains (.agt) as unique identifiers for AI agents, enabling a trustless, permissionless marketplace for AI services on the Polygon blockchain.

content: Architected smart contracts for on-chain agent registration
Implemented WebSocket validation for MCP endpoint verification
Built capability-based discovery and search functionality
Created Web3 wallet integration with RainbowKit
Developed real-time blockchain data synchronization
Designed intuitive UI for non-technical users to register agents

content.content: The platform consists of **three core components** working in harmony: 1. *Smart Contract Layer* â€¢ ERC-721 domain ownership verification â€¢ On-chain agent metadata storage â€¢ Capability tagging system â€¢ Active status tracking 2. *Frontend Application* â€¢ Next.js 14 with TypeScript â€¢ Real-time blockchain queries â€¢ WebSocket connection testing â€¢ Search and filter interface 3. *MCP Integration* â€¢ JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol support â€¢ WebSocket endpoint validation â€¢ Capability standardization â€¢ Agent chain linking

Several key innovations emerged from this project:

**1. Domain-Based Registration**
â€¢ Human-readable .agt domains instead of token IDs
â€¢ *Innovation:* Reverse lookup system for NFT metadata
â€¢ *Result:* Intuitive user experience for Web3 newcomers

**2. Live Endpoint Validation**
â€¢ Pre-registration WebSocket testing
â€¢ *Process:* Automated handshake verification
â€¢ *Benefit:* Ensures only working agents are registered

**3. Composable Agent Chains**
â€¢ Agents can reference other agents
â€¢ *Architecture:* Graph-based discovery network
â€¢ *Impact:* Enable complex AI workflows through composition

This project represents the convergence of two transformative technologies: 1. **Blockchain Benefits** Ownership: Agents tied to verifiable domain ownership Transparency: All registrations publicly auditable Censorship Resistance: No central authority can remove agents 2. **AI Accessibility** Discovery: Find specialized AI services by capability Interoperability: Standard MCP protocol for all agents Composability: Build complex workflows from simple agents 3. **Developer Experience** Templates: Ready-to-deploy MCP server examples Validation: Built-in testing before blockchain transactions Documentation: Comprehensive guides for agent builders The platform bridges the gap between Web3 infrastructure and practical AI applications.

content.content: Revolutionizing Construction Site Surveillance Through Intuitive Camera Control

Construction sites require **24/7 surveillance across multiple zones**, but security teams struggle with outdated PTZ camera interfaces that make rapid response nearly impossible. When theft, vandalism, or safety incidents occur, every second counts - yet operators waste precious time fighting with clunky controls.

Security personnel monitoring construction sites face a perfect storm of challenges: **multiple camera feeds across sprawling sites, the need for precise camera positioning to investigate incidents, and legacy interfaces designed by engineers rather than users.** Night shift operators particularly struggle with complex controls during critical moments when fatigue compounds usability issues.

The existing PTZ control software used by most construction security companies requires desktop installation, uses hypersensitive slider controls that make precise adjustments nearly impossible, and spreads controls across multiple panels that obscure the video feed.

content: Analyzed security operator workflows through ride-alongs and observation sessions at active construction sites
Identified critical pain points: imprecise slider controls, scattered interface elements, and slow response times
Developed **four complementary input methods** to accommodate different scenarios and operator preferences
Created responsive design supporting desktop monitoring stations, tablet field use, and emergency mobile access
Implemented millisecond-precision throttling to prevent camera motor overload while maintaining responsiveness
Built comprehensive keyboard shortcuts for experienced operators who need rapid camera repositioning
Established visual feedback system showing exact position values for incident documentation

content.content: Legacy vs. Modern: A Tale of Two Interfaces

The transformation from legacy to modern reveals **fundamental UX failures** in traditional PTZ software: **Legacy Interface Problems:** â€¢ Hypersensitive Sliders: Minimal movement causes large camera swings â€¢ Scattered Controls: Pan/tilt/zoom in separate interface regions â€¢ No Direct Input: Cannot type specific coordinates for repeatability â€¢ Delayed Response: 500ms+ lag between input and camera movement â€¢ Desktop-Only: Requires software installation on each workstation **Modern Solution Benefits:** â€¢ Precise Control: Multiple input methods for different precision needs â€¢ Unified Interface: All controls in peripheral vision while watching feed â€¢ Direct Value Entry: Type exact coordinates for incident documentation â€¢ Real-Time Response: 50ms throttled commands with instant feedback â€¢ Browser-Based: Access from any device without installation **Side-by-Side Comparison:** The legacy interface forces operators to constantly shift focus between the video feed and distant control sliders. Our redesign keeps all controls in the operator's peripheral vision, allowing continuous monitoring while adjusting camera position.

Version 1.2 introduces **purpose-built features** for construction site monitoring:

**1. Precision Value Controls**
â€¢ Direct coordinate entry for returning to specific positions
â€¢ *Security Use Case:* Document exact camera angles for incident reports
â€¢ *Implementation:* ContentEditable fields with validation
â€¢ *Increment Buttons:* Fine adjustments without losing video focus

**2. Axis Lock Mode**
â€¢ Isolate horizontal or vertical movement
â€¢ *Security Application:* Follow fence lines or scan floors systematically
â€¢ *Left-Click:* Pan-only for perimeter checks
â€¢ *Right-Click:* Tilt-only for multi-story scanning

**3. Hotkey Navigation System**
â€¢ P/T/Z keys instantly focus control fields
â€¢ *Night Shift Benefit:* Reduce eye strain from mouse movement
â€¢ *WASD Controls:* Gaming-familiar movement for younger operators
â€¢ *R Reset:* Instant return to default position after incident

**4. Click-and-Drag Adjustment**
â€¢ Drag on values for smooth, controlled changes
â€¢ *Advantage:* More precise than legacy sliders
â€¢ *Visual Feedback:* Cursor changes indicate drag mode
â€¢ *No Overshoot:* Natural resistance prevents accidental extreme positions

The interface design addresses **specific construction site security workflows**: 1. **Incident Investigation Mode** Scenario: Copper theft reported in Zone 3 Legacy Process: Fight with sliders, lose suspect while adjusting New Process: Type coordinates, zoom directly to hot spot Documentation: Save exact PTZ values for police report 2. **Perimeter Patrol Workflow** Scenario: Hourly fence line checks required Legacy Challenge: Sliders too sensitive for smooth panning Solution: Axis lock mode for controlled horizontal sweeps Benefit: Complete perimeter scan without missing blind spots 3. **Multi-Camera Coordination** Scenario: Track vehicle moving between camera zones Legacy Issue: Different interfaces per camera model Unified Interface: Same controls work for all PTZ cameras Result: Seamless handoff between camera operators 4. **Emergency Response** Scenario: Fire detected on upper floor Mobile Access: Security guard uses phone to check cameras Touch Controls: Pinch to zoom on specific area Speed: No software installation required for immediate access

The industry needed a solution that could handle the scale and complexity of multi-site monitoring while remaining simple enough for non-technical staff to operate effectively.

content.content: Creating the Premier Marketplace for Superintelligence Domain Names

The .si top-level domain presents a unique opportunity: **What if Slovenia's country code could become the de facto namespace for the superintelligence era?**

As AI capabilities advance toward AGI and beyond, forward-thinking organizations need domain names that signal their position in this transformation. The .si extension offers perfect dual meaning - both a legitimate country code and an abbreviation for superintelligence.

I recognized that no centralized marketplace existed for discovering, valuing, and trading premium .si domains specifically positioned for the AI industry. This gap represented both a technical challenge and a business opportunity.

content.content: Pick.si employs a **sophisticated distributed architecture** optimized for automation: 1. *Backend Services* â€¢ Django REST Framework with ViewSets â€¢ PostgreSQL with complex model relationships â€¢ Redis for Celery message broker â€¢ Custom WHOIS socket connections to arnes.si 2. *Frontend Application* â€¢ React with React Router for SPA navigation â€¢ Material-UI DataGrid with sorting and pagination â€¢ Stripe Elements for PCI-compliant payments â€¢ Real-time showcase status updates 3. *Automation Pipeline* â€¢ Celery workers with retry logic â€¢ BeautifulSoup web scraping for metadata â€¢ 5-second throttling between WHOIS queries â€¢ Scheduled tasks for expired showcase cleanup

The platform introduced several **technical breakthroughs** for domain marketplaces:

**1. Custom WHOIS Integration**
â€¢ Direct socket connection to whois.arnes.si (port 43)
â€¢ *Regex Parsing:* Extract registrar, nameservers, dates from raw WHOIS
â€¢ *Retry Logic:* MaxRetriesExceededError handling with exponential backoff
â€¢ *Rate Limiting:* 5-second delays prevent server blocking

**2. Showcase Listing System**
â€¢ Time-limited premium placement (7-day cycles)
â€¢ *Stripe Webhooks:* payment_intent.succeeded triggers upgrade
â€¢ *Automatic Expiration:* showcase_until field with timezone awareness
â€¢ *Visual Differentiation:* Light blue background (#e3f2fd) for showcase rows

**3. Advanced Search & Filtering**
â€¢ DjangoFilterBackend with custom DomainFilter class
â€¢ *Price Range:* Min/max price filtering with NumberFilter
â€¢ *Dual Pagination:* Separate controls for showcase vs standard domains
â€¢ *Smart Ordering:* Multi-field sorting (-is_showcase, -date_added, name)

**4. Bulk Import System**
â€¢ CSV parsing with comment line skipping
â€¢ *Error Handling:* Row-by-row validation with detailed error reporting
â€¢ *Batch Processing:* Celery task queuing for large imports

Implementing Pick.si required solving several **complex technical challenges**: 1. **WHOIS Server Integration** Challenge: .si WHOIS doesn't support standard Python whois library Solution: Raw socket programming with custom regex parsing Result: 100% reliable .si domain data extraction 2. **Payment Processing** Challenge: Secure upgrade flow with immediate status updates Solution: Stripe PaymentIntent with webhook verification Result: Zero failed transactions, instant showcase activation 3. **Performance at Scale** Challenge: Updating 500+ domains without overwhelming WHOIS servers Solution: Celery task distribution with intelligent throttling Result: Complete dataset updates in under 1 hour Each solution demonstrates deep understanding of distributed systems, API integration, and production-grade error handling.
